info.title: Kubeflow Pipelines API
info.description: This file contains REST API specification for Kubeflow Pipelines. The file is autogenerated from the swagger definition.

get.summary:
Finds all artifacts within the specified namespace.
Namespace field is required. In multi-user mode, the caller
is required to have RBAC verb "list" on the "artifacts"
resource for the specified namespace.

parameters.name: max_result_size
parameters.description:
Optional.
Max number of resources to return in the result. A value of zero or less
will result in the default (20).
The API implementation also enforces an upper-bound of 100, and picks the
minimum between this value and the one specified here.
[default = 20].

parameters.name: order_by_field
parameters.description: Optional. Ordering field. [default = ID].

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Optional. Can be either "asc" (ascending) or "desc" (descending). [default = asc].

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Optional. The next_page_token value returned from a previous List request, if any.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Required. Namespace of the Artifact's context.

get.summary: Finds a specific Artifact by ID.

parameters.name: artifact_id
parameters.description: Required. The ID of the artifact to be retrieved.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description:
Optional. Set to "DOWNLOAD" to included a signed URL with
an expiry (default 15 seconds, unless configured other wise).
This URL can be used to download the Artifact directly from
the Artifact's storage provider. Set to "BASIC" to exclude
the download_url from server responses, thus preventing the
creation of any signed url.
Defaults to BASIC.

 - ARTIFACT_VIEW_UNSPECIFIED: Not specified, equivalent to BASIC.
 - BASIC: Server responses excludes download_url
 - DOWNLOAD: Server responses include download_url

get.summary: Finds all experiments. Supports pagination, and sorting on certain fields.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
A page token to request the next page of results. The token is acquried
from the nextPageToken field of the response from the previous
ListExperiments call or can be omitted when fetching the first page.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of experiments to be listed per page. If there are more
experiments than this number, the response message will contain a
nextPageToken field you can use to fetch the next page.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Can be format of "field_name", "field_name asc" or "field_name desc"
Ascending by default.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
A url-encoded, JSON-serialized Filter protocol buffer (see
[filter.proto](https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/backend/api/v2beta1/api/filter.proto)).

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Which namespace to filter the experiments on.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The experiment to be created.

get.summary: Finds a specific experiment by ID.

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the experiment to be retrieved.

delete.summary:
Deletes an experiment without deleting the experiment's runs and recurring 
runs. To avoid unexpected behaviors, delete an experiment's runs and recurring 
runs before deleting the experiment.

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the experiment to be deleted.

post.summary: Archives an experiment and the experiment's runs and recurring runs.

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the experiment to be archived.

post.summary:
Restores an archived experiment. The experiment's archived runs and recurring
runs will stay archived.

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the experiment to be restored.

get.summary: Finds all pipelines within a namespace.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Optional input. Namespace for the pipelines.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: A page token to request the results page.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of pipelines to be listed per page. If there are more pipelines
than this number, the response message will contain a valid value in the
nextPageToken field.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Sorting order in form of "field_name", "field_name asc" or "field_name desc".
Ascending by default.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
A url-encoded, JSON-serialized filter protocol buffer (see
[filter.proto](https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/backend/api/filter.proto)).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Required input. Pipeline that needs to be created.

post.summary: Creates a new pipeline and a new pipeline version in a single transaction.

get.summary: Finds a specific pipeline by name and namespace.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Required input. Name of the pipeline to be retrieved.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description:
Optional input. Namespace of the pipeline. 
It could be empty if default namespaces needs to be used or if multi-user 
support is turned off.

get.summary: Finds a specific pipeline by ID.

parameters.name: pipeline_id
parameters.description: Required input. The ID of the pipeline to be retrieved.

delete.summary: Deletes an empty pipeline by ID. Returns error if the pipeline has pipeline versions.

parameters.name: pipeline_id
parameters.description: Required input. ID of the pipeline to be deleted.

get.summary: Lists all pipeline versions of a given pipeline ID.

parameters.name: pipeline_id
parameters.description: Required input. ID of the parent pipeline.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: A page token to request the results page.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of pipeline versions to be listed per page. If there are more pipeline
versions than this number, the response message will contain a valid value in the
nextPageToken field.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Sorting order in form of "field_name", "field_name asc" or "field_name desc".
Ascending by default.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
A url-encoded, JSON-serialized filter protocol buffer (see
[filter.proto](https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/backend/api/filter.proto)).

post.summary: Adds a pipeline version to the specified pipeline ID.

parameters.name: pipeline_id
parameters.description: Required input. ID of the parent pipeline.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Required input. Pipeline version ID to be created.

get.summary: Gets a pipeline version by pipeline version ID and pipeline ID.

parameters.name: pipeline_id
parameters.description: Required input. ID of the parent pipeline.

parameters.name: pipeline_version_id
parameters.description: Required input. ID of the pipeline version to be retrieved.

delete.summary: Deletes a specific pipeline version by pipeline version ID and pipeline ID.

parameters.name: pipeline_id
parameters.description: Required input. ID of the parent pipeline.

parameters.name: pipeline_version_id
parameters.description: Required input. The ID of the pipeline version to be deleted.

parameters.name: uploadfile
parameters.description: The pipeline to upload. Maximum size of 32MB is supported.

parameters.name: uploadfile
parameters.description: The pipeline to upload. Maximum size of 32MB is supported.

get.summary:
Finds all recurring runs given experiment and namespace. 
If experiment ID is not specified, find all recurring runs across all experiments.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
A page token to request the next page of results. The token is acquired
from the nextPageToken field of the response from the previous
ListRecurringRuns call or can be omitted when fetching the first page.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of recurring runs to be listed per page. If there are more recurring runs 
than this number, the response message will contain a nextPageToken field you can use
to fetch the next page.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Can be formatted as "field_name", "field_name asc" or "field_name desc".
Ascending by default.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Optional input. The namespace the recurring runs belong to.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
A url-encoded, JSON-serialized Filter protocol buffer (see
[filter.proto](https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/backend/api/filter.proto)).

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the experiment to be retrieved. If empty, list recurring runs across all experiments.

post.summary: Creates a new recurring run in an experiment, given the experiment ID.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The recurring run to be created.

get.summary: Finds a specific recurring run by ID.

parameters.name: recurring_run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the recurring run to be retrieved.

parameters.name: recurring_run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the recurring run to be deleted.

post.summary: Stops a recurring run and all its associated runs. The recurring run is not deleted.

parameters.name: recurring_run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the recurring runs to be disabled.

post.summary:
Restarts a recurring run that was previously stopped. All runs associated with the 
recurring run will continue.

parameters.name: recurring_run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the recurring runs to be enabled.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: ScheduledWorkflow a ScheduledWorkflow resource marshalled into a json string.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Workflow is a workflow custom resource marshalled into a json string.

get.summary:
Finds all runs in an experiment given by experiment ID. 
If experiment id is not specified, finds all runs across all experiments.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Optional input field. Filters based on the namespace.

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the parent experiment. If empty, response includes runs across all experiments.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
A page token to request the next page of results. The token is acquired
from the nextPageToken field of the response from the previous
ListRuns call or can be omitted when fetching the first page.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of runs to be listed per page. If there are more runs than this
number, the response message will contain a nextPageToken field you can use
to fetch the next page.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Can be format of "field_name", "field_name asc" or "field_name desc"
(Example, "name asc" or "id desc"). Ascending by default.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
A url-encoded, JSON-serialized Filter protocol buffer (see
[filter.proto](https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/backend/api/filter.proto)).

post.summary:
Creates a new run in an experiment specified by experiment ID. 
If experiment ID is not specified, the run is created in the default experiment.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Run to be created.

get.summary: Finds a specific run by ID.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the run to be retrieved.

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the parent experiment.

delete.summary: Deletes a run in an experiment given by run ID and experiment ID.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the run to be deleted.

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the parent experiment.

get.summary: Finds artifact data in a run.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: ID of the run.

parameters.name: node_id
parameters.description: ID of the running node.

parameters.name: artifact_name
parameters.description: Name of the artifact.

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the parent experiment.

post.summary: Archives a run in an experiment given by run ID and experiment ID.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the run to be archived.

post.summary: Re-initiates a failed or terminated run.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the run to be retried.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the run to be terminated.

post.summary: Restores an archived run in an experiment given by run ID and experiment ID.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the run to be restored.

GetArtifactRequestArtifactView.title:
- ARTIFACT_VIEW_UNSPECIFIED: Not specified, equivalent to BASIC.
 - BASIC: Server responses excludes download_url
 - DOWNLOAD: Server responses include download_url

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

googlerpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

artifact_id.description: Unique Artifact ID. Generated by MLMD.

storage_provider.description: Storage Provider to which this Artifact is located (e.g. S3, Minio, etc.).

storage_path.description:
The path location of this Artifact within the storage provider.
For example an object located at s3://my-bucket/path/a/b/c will
result in "path/a/b/c".

download_url.description:
Optional Output. Specifies a signed-url that can be used to
download this Artifact directly from its store.

namespace.description:
The namespace associated with this Artifact. This is determined
by the namespace of the parent PipelineRun that created this Artifact.

artifact_type.title: The MLMD type of the artifact (e.g. system.Dataset)

artifact_size.description:
The size of the artifact in bytes.
If the artifact does not exist in object store (e.g. Metrics)
then this is omitted.

last_updated_at.description: Last update time of the artifact.

error.description:
In case any error happens retrieving an artifact field, only artifact ID
and the error message is returned. Client has the flexibility of choosing
how to handle the error. This is especially useful when calling ListArtifacts.

next_page_token.title: Token to retrieve the next page of results, or empty if there are none

AuthorizeRequestResources.description: Type of resources in pipelines system.

AuthorizeRequestVerb.description: Type of verbs that act on the resources.

experiment_id.description: Output. Unique experiment ID. Generated by API server.

display_name.description: Required input field. Unique experiment name provided by user.

description.description: Optional input field. Describes the purpose of the experiment.

created_at.description: Output. The time that the experiment was created.

namespace.description: Optional input field. Specify the namespace this experiment belongs to.

storage_state.description: Output. Specifies whether this experiment is in archived or available state.

last_run_created_at.description: Output. The creation time of the last run in this experiment.

v2beta1ExperimentStorageState.description:
Describes whether an entity is available or archived.

 - STORAGE_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Default state. This state in not used
 - AVAILABLE: Entity is available.
 - ARCHIVED: Entity is archived.

total_size.description: The number of experiments for the given query.

next_page_token.description: The token to list the next page of experiments.

predicates.description: All predicates are AND-ed when this filter is applied.

timestamp_value.description:
Timestamp values will be converted to Unix time (seconds since the epoch)
prior to being used in a filtering operation.

int_values.description: Array values below are only meant to be used by the IN operator.

v2beta1Predicate.description:
Predicate captures individual conditions that must be true for a resource
being filtered.

v2beta1PredicateOperation.description:
Operation is the operation to apply.

 - OPERATION_UNSPECIFIED: Default operation. This operation is not used.
 - EQUALS: Operation on scalar values. Only applies to one of |int_value|,
|long_value|, |string_value| or |timestamp_value|.
 - NOT_EQUALS: Negated EQUALS.
 - GREATER_THAN: Greater than operation.
 - GREATER_THAN_EQUALS: Greater than or equals operation.
 - LESS_THAN: Less than operation.
 - LESS_THAN_EQUALS: Less than or equals operation
 - IN: Checks if the value is a member of a given array, which should be one of
|int_values|, |long_values| or |string_values|.
 - IS_SUBSTRING: Checks if the value contains |string_value| as a substring match. Only
applies to |string_value|.

multi_user.description: Returns if KFP in multi-user mode
multi_user.title:
TODO(gkcalat): redesign this service to return status
and move server configuration into a separate service
TODO(gkcalat): rename or deprecate v1beta1 HealthzService

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

 The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.

pipeline.description: Required input. Pipeline (parent) to be created.

pipeline_version.description:
Required input. Pipeline version (child) to be created.
Pipeline spec will be downloaded from pipeline_version.package_url.

next_page_token.description: The token to list the next page of pipeline versions.

total_size.description: The total number of pipeline versions for the given query.
The total number of pipelines for the given query.

next_page_token.description:
The token to list the next page of pipelines.
This token can be used on the next ListPipelinesRequest.

pipeline_id.description: Output. Unique pipeline ID. Generated by API server.

display_name.description: Required input field. Pipeline name provided by user.

description.description: Optional input field. A short description of the pipeline.

created_at.description: Output. Creation time of the pipeline.

namespace.description:
Input. A namespace this pipeline belongs to.
Causes error if user is not authorized to access the specified namespace.
If not specified in CreatePipeline, default namespace is used.

error.description:
In case any error happens retrieving a pipeline field, only pipeline ID,
and the error message is returned. Client has the flexibility of choosing
how to handle the error. This is especially useful during listing call.

pipeline_id.description: Required input field. Unique ID of the parent pipeline.

pipeline_version_id.description: Output. Unique pipeline version ID. Generated by API server.

display_name.description: Required input field. Pipeline version name provided by user.

description.description: Optional input field. Short description of the pipeline version.

created_at.description: Output. Creation time of the pipeline version.

package_url.description:
Input. Required. The URL to the source of the pipeline version.
This is required when creating the pipeine version through
CreatePipelineVersion API.

code_source_url.description:
Input. Optional. The URL to the code source of the pipeline version.
The code is usually the Python definition of the pipeline and potentially
related the component definitions. This allows users to trace back to how
the pipeline YAML was created.

pipeline_spec.description: Output. The pipeline spec for the pipeline version.

error.description:
In case any error happens retrieving a pipeline version field, only
pipeline ID, pipeline version ID, and the error message are returned. 
Client has the flexibility of choosing how to handle the error. 
This is especially useful during List() calls.

pipeline_url.description: URL of the pipeline version definition.

RecurringRunMode.description:
Required input.
User setting to enable or disable the recurring run. 
Only used for creation of recurring runs. Later updates use enable/disable API.

 - DISABLE: The recurring run won't schedule any run if disabled.

start_time.description: The start time of the cron job.

end_time.description: The end time of the cron job.

cron.title:
The cron string. For details how to compose a cron, visit
ttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron

v2beta1CronSchedule.description: CronSchedule allow scheduling the recurring run with unix-like cron.

recurringRuns.description: A list of recurring runs returned.

total_size.description: The total number of recurring runs for the given query.

next_page_token.description: The token to list the next page of recurring runs.

start_time.description: The start time of the periodic recurring run.

end_time.description: The end time of the periodic recurring run.

interval_second.description: The time interval between the starting time of consecutive recurring runs.

v2beta1PeriodicSchedule.description: PeriodicSchedule allow scheduling the recurring run periodically with certain interval.

pipeline_id.description: Input. Required. Unique ID of the parent pipeline.

pipeline_version_id.description: Input. Required. Unique ID of an existing pipeline version.

v2beta1PipelineVersionReference.description: Reference to an existing pipeline version.

recurring_run_id.description: Output. Unique run ID generated by API server.

display_name.description: Required input field. Recurring run name provided by user. Not unique.

description.description: Optional input field. Describes the purpose of the recurring run.

pipeline_version_id.description: The ID of the pipeline version used for creating runs.

pipeline_version_reference.description: Reference to a pipeline version containing pipeline_id and pipeline_version_id.

service_account.description: Optional input field. Specifies which Kubernetes service account this recurring run uses.

max_concurrency.description:
Required input field.
Specifies how many runs can be executed concurrently. Range [1-10].

trigger.description:
Required input field.
Specifies how a run is triggered. Support cron mode or periodic mode.

created_at.description: Output. The time this recurring run was created.

updated_at.description: Output. The last time this recurring run was updated.

error.description:
In case any error happens retrieving a recurring run field, only recurring run ID
and the error message is returned. Client has the flexibility of choosing
how to handle the error. This is especially useful during listing call.

no_catchup.description:
Optional input field. Whether the recurring run should catch up if behind schedule.
If true, the recurring run will only schedule the latest interval if behind schedule.
If false, the recurring run will catch up on each past interval.

namespace.description:
TODO (gkclat): consider removing this field if it can be obtained from the parent experiment.
Output only. Namespace this recurring run belongs to. Derived from the parent experiment.

experiment_id.description: ID of the parent experiment this recurring run belongs to.

v2beta1RecurringRunStatus.description: Output. The status of the recurring run.

parameters.description:
The runtime parameters of the Pipeline. The parameters will be
used to replace the placeholders at runtime.

pipeline_root.title:
A path in a object store bucket which will be treated as the root
output directory of the pipeline. It is used by the system to
generate the paths of output artifacts. 
Ref:(https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/components/pipelines/pipeline-root/)

v2beta1Trigger.description: Trigger defines what starts a pipeline run.

pod_name.description:
Name of the corresponding pod assigned by the orchestration engine.
Also known as node_id.

PipelineTaskDetailChildTask.description:
A dependent task that requires this one to succeed.
Represented by either task_id or pod_name.

artifact_ids.description: A list of artifact metadata ids.

total_size.description: The total number of runs for the given query.

next_page_token.description: The token to list the next page of runs.

display_name.description:
User specified name of a task that is defined in
[Pipeline.spec][].

execution_id.description: Execution id of the corresponding entry in ML metadata store.

error.description:
The error that occurred during task execution.
Only populated when the task is in FAILED or CANCELED state.

parent_task_id.description:
ID of the parent task if the task is within a component scope.
Empty if the task is at the root level.

state_history.description:
A sequence of task statuses. This field keeps a record 
of state transitions.

pod_name.description:
Name of the corresponding pod assigned by the orchestration engine.
Also known as node_id.

v2beta1PipelineTaskDetail.description: Runtime information of a task execution.

main_job.description: The name of the job for the main container execution.

pre_caching_check_job.description:
The name of the job for the pre-caching-check container
execution. This job will be available if the
Run.pipeline_spec specifies the `pre_caching_check` hook in
the lifecycle events.

failed_main_jobs.description:
The names of the previously failed job for the main container
executions. The list includes the all attempts in chronological order.

failed_pre_caching_check_jobs.description:
The names of the previously failed job for the
pre-caching-check container executions. This job will be available if the
Run.pipeline_spec specifies the `pre_caching_check` hook in
the lifecycle events.
The list includes the all attempts in chronological order.

v2beta1PipelineTaskExecutorDetail.description: Runtime information of a pipeline task executor.

data.description: Byte array of the artifact content.

experiment_id.description:
Input. ID of the parent experiment.
The default experiment ID will be used if this is not specified.

run_id.description: Output. Unique run ID. Generated by API server.

display_name.description:
Required input. Name provided by user,
or auto generated if run is created by a recurring run.

storage_state.description: Output. Specifies whether this run is in archived or available mode.

description.description: Optional input. Short description of the run.

pipeline_version_id.description: ID of an existing pipeline version.

pipeline_version_reference.description: Reference to a pipeline version containing pipeline_id and pipeline_version_id.

runtime_config.description: Required input. Runtime config of the run.

service_account.description: Optional input. Specifies which kubernetes service account is used.

created_at.description: Output. Creation time of the run.

scheduled_at.description:
Output. When this run is scheduled to start. This could be different from
created_at. For example, if a run is from a backfilling job that was supposed
to run 2 month ago, the created_at will be 2 month behind scheduled_at.

state.description: Output. Runtime state of a run.

error.description:
In case any error happens retrieving a run field, only run ID
and the error message is returned. Client has the flexibility of choosing
how to handle the error. This is especially useful during listing call.

run_details.description: Output. Runtime details of a run.

recurring_run_id.description: ID of the recurring run that triggered this run.

state_history.description:
Output. A sequence of run statuses. This field keeps a record 
of state transitions.

pipeline_context_id.description: Pipeline context ID of a run.

pipeline_run_context_id.description: Pipeline run context ID of a run.

task_details.description: Runtime details of the tasks that belong to the run.

v2beta1RunStorageState.description:
Describes whether an entity is available or archived.

 - STORAGE_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Default state. This state in not used
 - AVAILABLE: Entity is available.
 - ARCHIVED: Entity is archived.

v2beta1RuntimeState.description:
Describes the runtime state of an entity.

 - RUNTIME_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value. This value is not used.
 - PENDING: Service is preparing to execute an entity.
 - RUNNING: Entity execution is in progress.
 - SUCCEEDED: Entity completed successfully.
 - SKIPPED: Entity has been skipped. For example, due to caching.
 - FAILED: Entity execution has failed.
 - CANCELING: Entity is being canceled. From this state, an entity may only
change its state to SUCCEEDED, FAILED or CANCELED.
 - CANCELED: Entity has been canceled.
 - PAUSED: Entity has been paused. It can be resumed.

state.description: The state of a runtime instance.

error.description:
The error that occurred during the state. May be set when the state is
any of the non-final states (PENDING/RUNNING/CANCELING) or FAILED state.
If the state is FAILED, the error here is final and not going to be
retried. If the state is a non-final state, the error indicates that a 
system-error being retried.

v2beta1RuntimeStatus.description: Timestamped representation of a runtime state with an optional error.

source.description:
Path pattern of input data to be used during generation of visualizations.
This is required when creating the pipeline through CreateVisualization
API.

arguments.description:
Variables to be used during generation of a visualization.
This should be provided as a JSON string.
This is required when creating the pipeline through CreateVisualization
API.

error.description:
In case any error happens when generating visualizations, only
visualization ID and the error message are returned. Client has the
flexibility of choosing how to handle the error.

v2beta1VisualizationType.description:
Type of visualization to be generated.
This is required when creating the pipeline through CreateVisualization
API.
